item.title: 摩根大通推出面向长期客户的咨询服务部门
item.description: 摩根大通（J.P. Morgan）周一表示，该公司成立了一个新的咨询部门，为特定客户群提供服务，并拓宽他们获取传统交易和融资之外的专业知识的渠道。【原文：J.P. Morgan said on Monday it launched a new advisory unit to serve a select group of clients and widen their access to expertise beyond traditional dealmaking and financing.】

item.title: 英国要求埃隆-马斯克的 Grok 公司回应有关性爱照片的担忧
item.description: 英国要求埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的社交媒体网站 X 解释其人工智能聊天机器人 "格罗克"（Grok）是如何生成人们的裸体图像和儿童性图像的，以及它是否没有履行保护用户的法律义务。【原文：Britain has demanded Elon Musk's social media site X explain how its AI chatbot Grok was able to produce undressed images of people and sexualised images of children, and whether it was failing in its legal duty to protect users.】

item.title: 超过 145 个国家同意更新全球最低税率协议，解决美国的担忧
item.description: 超过 145 个国家周一同意修改 2021 年全球最低企业税协议，以消除华盛顿对该规则可能惩罚美国跨国公司的担忧。【原文：More than 145 countries agreed on Monday to amend a 2021 global minimum corporate tax agreement, addressing Washington's concerns the rules could penalise U.S. multinational companies.】

item.title: ISM称，2025年结束后，美国工厂部门下滑至14个月低点
item.description: 由于新订单再次下降，投入成本不断攀升，美国制造业继续受到唐纳德-特朗普总统进口关税的影响，12月份美国制造业活动萎缩幅度超过预期，连续10个月下滑。【原文：U.S. manufacturing activity contracted more than expected in December, extending its slump to 10 straight months as new orders fell again and input costs kept grinding higher as the sector continues to bear the imprint of President Donald Trump's import tariffs.】

item.title: 独家报道诺和诺德美国公共事务主管离职
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，丹麦肥胖症药品生产商诺和诺德公司在美国的公共事务主管已经离职，而此时该公司正在努力重振其在美国第一大市场的命运。【原文：Danish obesity drugmaker Novo Nordisk's head of public affairs in the U.S. has left the company, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters, at a time when the firm is battling to revive its fortunes in its top market.】

item.title: Bed Bath & Beyond 任命内部人士 Marcus Lemonis 为首席执行官
item.description: Bed Bath & Beyond 执行主席马库斯-莱莫尼斯（Marcus Lemonis）在周一提交的一份监管文件中表示，该公司已被任命为新任首席执行官。【原文：Bed Bath & Beyond Executive Chairman Marcus Lemonis has been named as its new CEO, the company said in a regulatory filing on Monday.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利表示，委内瑞拉对美国经济的风险来自油价，但目前尚未发现
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联储主席尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）周一表示，特朗普政府上周末抓捕委内瑞拉领导人给美国经济带来的主要风险将来自油价上涨，但到目前为止，这种情况似乎并未发生。【原文：The main risk to the U.S. economy from the Trump administration's capture of Venezuela's leader over the weekend would stem from rising oil prices, Minneapolis Federal Reserve President Neel Kashkari said on Monday, but that does not appear to be underway so far.】

item.title: 全球供应短缺吊足投资者胃口，内存芯片制造商股价上涨
item.description: 全球顶级存储芯片供应商的股票周一上涨，原因是人工智能基础设施需求激增导致全球供应紧张，投资者押注价格将进一步上涨。【原文：Shares of the world's top memory chip providers rose on Monday as investors bet on further price gains due to a global supply crunch driven by surging demand for artificial-intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: 即使电动汽车销量落后于产量增长，Lucid 的交付量仍超出预期
item.description: 电动汽车制造商 Lucid Group 周一公布的第四季度和 2025 年的交付量略高于预期，原因是价格较低的 Gravity SUV 受到市场欢迎，帮助该公司抵消了因美国税收抵免到期而导致的需求疲软。【原文：Electric vehicle maker Lucid Group on Monday reported fourth-quarter and 2025 deliveries that were slightly above expectations, as a good reception for the cheaper Gravity SUV helped it offset weaker demand due to the expiry of U.S. tax credits.】

item.title: 中国在委内瑞拉的石油投资
item.description: 中国是委内瑞拉石油业的主要客户和投资者，在美国军方周六推翻总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗之后，唐纳德-特朗普总统希望重振委内瑞拉石油业。【原文：China is a major customer of and investor in Venezuela's oil sector, which President Donald Trump aims to revive following the U.S. military's ouster of President Nicolas Maduro on Saturday.】

item.title: 菲利普斯 66 收购英国林赛炼油厂资产
item.description: 菲利普斯 66 周一表示，该公司已同意在英格兰北部林赛炼油厂清算后收购其资产和基础设施，并将把主要设施并入其亨伯炼油厂。【原文：Phillips 66 said on Monday it had agreed to acquire the assets and infrastructure of Lindsey Oil Refinery in northern England, following the site's liquidation, and will integrate the key facilities into its Humber Refinery.】

item.title: L3Harris 以 8.45 亿美元出售太空推进器业务 60% 的股份
item.description: L3Harris Technologies 公司周一表示，将以 8.45 亿美元（包括债务）的价格向私募股权公司 AE Industrial Partners 出售其太空推进与动力系统业务约 60% 的股份。【原文：L3Harris Technologies said on Monday it will sell an about 60% stake in its space propulsion and power systems business to private equity firm AE Industrial Partners for $845 million, including debt.】

item.title: 预计 2026 年油价将在供应充足的压力下有所缓解
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，由于供应增长和需求疲软抑制了油价，2026年全球石油市场可能面临压力，交易商将密切关注欧佩克+的政策信号和任何提振市场的尝试。【原文：The global oil market is likely to be under pressure in 2026 as growing supply and weak demand curb prices, and traders monitor OPEC+ for policy signals and any attempts to bolster the market, a Reuters poll showed on Monday.】

item.title: 康卡斯特完成对 Versant 媒体集团的剥离
item.description: 康卡斯特（Comcast）周一表示，已完成 Versant Media Group 的分拆，成为一家独立的上市公司，并于周五生效。【原文：Comcast on Monday said it has completed the spinoff of Versant Media Group into a separate public company, effective as of Friday.】

item.title: Mobileye 与美国主要汽车制造商达成协议，生产前景看好
item.description: Mobileye 周一表示，该公司已获得一家美国大型汽车制造商作为其下一代芯片的客户，从而提升了生产前景，其自动驾驶技术将作为数百万辆汽车的标准设备推出。【原文：Mobileye said on Monday it has secured a major U.S. automaker as a customer for its next-generation chip, lifting production outlook, with its self-driving technology rolled out as standard equipment in millions of vehicles.】

item.title: 石油公司因委内瑞拉震荡而跳涨，美国股指期货上扬
item.description: 在经历了前一周的下跌之后，与 S&P 500 指数和纳斯达克指数挂钩的期货在周一逐步走高，部分原因是石油公司在委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗被美国通过军事打击抓获后大涨。【原文：Futures linked to the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq inched higher on Monday after losses in the previous week, partially boosted by oil companies that surged following the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by the United States in a military strike.】

item.title: 阿波罗牵头的投资者将向建筑产品公司 QXO 投资 12 亿美元
item.description: QXO 周一表示，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）和其他一些投资者已同意向这家建筑产品分销商投资 12 亿美元，以支持其进行收购。【原文：QXO on Monday said that Apollo Global Management and certain other investors have agreed to invest $1.2 billion in the building-products distributor to support its acquisition pursuits.】

item.title: 腾讯支持的金融科技公司 Airwallex 将投资荷兰
item.description: 澳大利亚支付公司 Airwallex 周一表示，未来五年将向荷兰业务投资约 2 亿欧元（约合 2.3364 亿美元），这标志着该公司从亚太基地转向欧洲的重大扩张。【原文：Australian payment firm Airwallex said on Monday it will invest around 200 million euros ($233.64 million) over the next five years in its Netherlands operations, marking a major European expansion as it shifts from its Asia-Pacific base.】

item.title: 地缘政治在新的一年占据中心位置
item.description: Dhara Ranasinghe 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天。【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by Dhara Ranasinghe.】

item.title: 随着人工智能技术的成熟，投资者或将在 2026 年寻找价值投资机会
item.description: 多位分析师表示，随着人们对人工智能泡沫的担忧与日俱增，促使交易商将目光投向估值较高的科技股之外，全球投资者今年将积极在金融市场价值被低估的领域寻找机会。【原文：Global investors will actively seek opportunities this year in undervalued pockets of financial markets as growing concerns over an AI bubble push traders to look beyond highly valued technology stocks, according to several analysts.】

item.title: 自动驾驶技术和人工智能在 CES 上大放异彩，汽车制造商缩减电动汽车计划
item.description: 自动驾驶技术预计将在本周拉斯维加斯举行的 CES 展会上占据主导地位，因为投资者押注人工智能将为这个饱受进展缓慢、成本高昂、安全事故和监管审查困扰的行业注入活力。【原文：Autonomous driving technology is expected to dominate the CES trade show in Las Vegas this week as investors bet that artificial intelligence will invigorate an industry beset by slow progress, high costs, safety incidents and regulatory scrutiny.】

item.title: 特朗普对委内瑞拉石油采取行动后，雪佛龙和美国炼油商股价大涨
item.description: 美国石油公司的股票在周一盘前交易中上涨，因为投资者押注唐纳德-特朗普总统针对委内瑞拉领导层的举动将使美国公司有更多机会获得世界上最大的石油储备。【原文：U.S. oil companies' shares rose in premarket trading on Monday as investors bet that President Donald Trump's move against Venezuela's leadership would allow American firms greater access to the world's largest oil reserves.】

item.title: 科迪亚克人工智能公司与博世合作，扩大自动驾驶卡车的硬件规模
item.description: 科迪亚克人工智能公司（Kodiak AI）周一表示，该公司已与博世合作，加强自动驾驶卡车硬件和传感器的制造，因为这家自动驾驶卡车公司希望从试点部署转向大规模商业推广。【原文：Kodiak AI said on Monday it has partnered with Bosch to ramp up manufacturing of autonomous trucking hardware and sensors, as the self-driving truck company looks to move from pilot deployments toward large-scale commercial rollout.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Nexperia 纠纷公开听证会定于 1 月 14 日举行
item.description: 周一，两位熟悉法律诉讼程序的消息人士告诉路透社，荷兰法院将于 1 月 14 日举行听证会，听取有关是否应对 Nexperia 公司涉嫌管理不善展开正式调查的争论。【原文：A Dutch court will hold a hearing on January 14 to hear arguments as to whether it should open a formal investigation into alleged mismanagement at Nexperia, two sources familiar with the legal proceedings told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：中国敦促银行披露与委内瑞拉的贷款关系
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周一援引知情人士的话报道称，在美国逮捕委内瑞拉总统后，中国最高金融监管机构要求其政策性银行和其他主要贷款机构报告其对委内瑞拉的贷款风险敞口。【原文：China's top financial regulator asked its policy banks and other major lenders to report their lending exposure to Venezuela after the U.S. capture of the Venezuelan president, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚博思格钢铁公司称 12 月收到 88 亿美元收购要约
item.description: 澳大利亚博思格钢铁公司（BlueScope Steel）周一表示，该公司在 12 月份收到了一个由澳大利亚和美国公司组成的财团提出的指示性收购要约，对这家钢铁制造商的估值为 131.5 亿澳元（87.8 亿美元）。【原文：Australia's BlueScope Steel on Monday said it received an indicative takeover offer in December from a consortium of Australian and U.S. companies, valuing the steelmaker at A$13.15 billion ($8.78 billion).】

item.title: 印度尼西亚前部长马卡里姆因采购谷歌笔记本电脑面临贪污指控
item.description: 印尼检察官周一对前教育部长、初创公司 Gojek 联合创始人纳迪姆-马卡里姆（Nadiem Makarim）提出腐败指控，称他在笔记本电脑大流行期间采购不当，导致国家损失 1.2564 亿美元。【原文：Indonesian prosecutors on Monday filed corruption charges against former education minister and the co-founder of startup Gojek, Nadiem Makarim, over alleged improper laptop procurement during the pandemic that led to $125.64 million in state losses.】

item.title: 诺和诺德将向美国自费患者出售韦格韦药片，起价为每月 149 美元
item.description: 丹麦诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk）周一表示，从1月5日起，该公司将以每月149美元的价格向美国自费患者提供1.5毫克和4毫克的Wegovy减肥药。【原文：Denmark's Novo Nordisk will offer its 1.5 and 4 milligram Wegovy weightloss pills at $149 per month to self-paying patients in the United States from January 5, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 富士康第四季度收入增长 22%，创人工智能需求历史新高
item.description: 受人工智能产品强劲需求的推动，全球最大的合约电子制造商台湾富士康周一公布了创纪录的第四季度收入报告。【原文：Taiwan's Foxconn, the world's largest contract electronics maker, reported record fourth-quarter revenue on Monday, driven by strong demand for artificial intelligence products.】

item.title: 台湾检方对台积电商业机密案追加起诉
item.description: 台湾检方周一表示，已对涉嫌窃取芯片制造商台积电商业机密的东京电子台湾分公司及其他三名被告追加起诉。【原文：Taiwan prosecutors said on Monday it had filed additional indictments against the Taiwan unit of Tokyo Electron and three other defendants in a case involving the alleged theft of trade secrets from chipmaker TSMC.】
